TUE / November 1

Below Deck Adventure Trailer Reality Bravo, 9p

THU / November 3

▣ Blockbuster Trailer Comedy

Inspired by the true story of the planet's sole remaining Blockbuster Video location (in Bend, Oregon)—also the subject of a recent documentary—Netflix's new sitcom is a single-camera workplace comedy set in the last Blockbuster standing. Randall Park stars as the store's manager, and he's joined there by Melissa Fumero, Madeleine Arthur, JB Smoove, Tyler Alvarez, Olga Merediz, and Kamaia Fairburn. The series comes from Superstore/Brooklyn Nine-Nine writer Vanessa Ramos and also counts David Caspe (Happy Endings) among its producers. Ten episodes stream today, but you'll need to return them within three days if you don't want to pay any late fees.

▣ The Capture Drama Peacock

Hip Hop Homicides Trailer Reality WE, tbd

KanColle Anime Crunchyroll

Kold X Windy Reality WE, tbd

The Really Loud House Trailer Comedy/Family Nickelodeon, 7p

Rehab Addict Lake House Rescue Reality HGTV, 9p

▣ The Suspect Drama Sundance Now

FRI / November 4

Buying Beverly Hills Trailer Reality

▣ Causeway Trailer Drama Apple TV+

Jennifer Lawrence stars as an American soldier who suffers a traumatic brain injury while serving in Afghanistan and struggles to readjust to life at home in this A24-produced drama from first-time director Lila Neugebauer. Brian Tyree Henrey, Linda Emond, and Jayne Houdyshell also star.

Star Millie Bobby Brown and director Harry Bradbeer return for a sequel to Netflix's 2020 mystery film based on Nancy Springer's book series about Sherlock Holmes' less-famous sister. Henry Cavill, David Thewlis, and Helena Bonham Carter also star.

The Fabulous Trailer Foreign/Drama

I'm Totally Fine Trailer Sci-fi/Comedy ($) Rent/Buy

Lookism Trailer Anime

▣ Lopez vs. Lopez Comedy 8p

George Lopez stars opposite his real-life daughter Mayan Lopez in NBC's new family comedy.

A Magical Christmas Village Drama Hallmark, 8p

▣ Manifest Trailer Drama

The former NBC series moves to Netflix for its fourth and final season, which will be split into two parts. Ten episodes stream today.

▣ The Mosquito Coast Drama Apple TV+

▣ My Policeman Trailer Drama Prime Video

Harry Styles, Emma Corrin, and David Dawson star in a Greg Berlanti-produced romance set in Britain in both the 1950s and '90s. The adaptation of the book by Bethan Roberts will also play in theaters beginning October 21.

Selena Gomez: My Mind & Me Documentary Apple TV+

Slumberkins Family/Animation Apple TV+

Daniel Radcliffe stars as beloved musician and song parodist “Weird Al" Yankovic in a comedic, Funny or Die-produced biopic about Yankovic's music career and personal life—with only most of the facts changed. Yankovic himself co-wrote the script, making it his first film project since his 1989 cult classic UHF. Eric Appel (Brooklyn Nine-Nine, Silicon Valley) directs a cast that also includes Quinta Brunson (as Oprah Winfrey), Evan Rachel Wood (as Madonna), and Rainn Wilson (as legendary DJ Dr. Demento), while Toby Huss and Julianne Nicholson play Al's parents.

Young Rock Comedy 8:30p

SUN / November 6

All Saints Christmas Drama Hallmark, 8p

Dangerous Liaisons Trailer Drama Starz, 9p

The latest take on the 18th century French novel—a tale of romance and backstabbing which has been adapted multiple times in seemingly every medium imaginable, though this is the first English-language TV adaptation— depicts the romantic entanglements of members of the court of Louis VXI in 18th century Paris, and, in particular, the orign story of the complicated relationship between Merteuil (Alice Englert) and Valmont (Nicholas Denton). The reimagining comes from Harriet Warner (Call the Midwife, Tell Me Your Secrets) and also stars Leslie Manville, Paloma Faith, and Game of Thrones alumni Carice van Houten and Michael McElhatton.

Love at the Christmas Contest Drama GAF, 8p

▣ Mood Drama BBC America, tbd

Nicole Lecky adapts her own play Superhoe into a six-part series in which she plays an aspiring recording artist who attempts to recover from a major setback by becoming an online influencer.

Spector Trailer Documentary 9p

Showtime's four-part series re-examines the life of legendary music producer Phil Spector in light of the murder trial for which he became famous anew toward the end of his life—and also focuses on the life of the murder victim, actress Lana Clarkson. Streamers can catch the entire series early on Friday 11/4.

56th Annual CMA Awards Live event/Music 8p

Luke Bryan and Peyton Manning host.

▣ The Crown Drama

The fifth of what will eventually be six seasons of Netflix's hit Emmy-winning period drama about the life of Queen Elizabeth II brings another cast overhaul as the story jumps forward in time to the mid-1990s—and the eventual death of Princess Diana (now played by Elizabeth Debicki). Imelda Staunton takes over as the Queen, while Jonathan Pryce now plays Prince Philip, Lesley Manville is Princess Margaret, and Jonny Lee Miller portrays new Prime Minister John Major. Also starring this season, as then-Prince Charles and Camilla Parker Bowles, are Dominic West and Olivia Williams, respectively, while the former's real-life son Senan West plays Prince William as a teenager (though not until the end of the season).

Rooted: America's Tree of Life Reality Smithsonian, 8p

Save Our Squad With David Beckham Trailer Reality Disney+

Zootopia+ Animation/Family/Anthology Disney+

Six animated shorts—each adopting a different TV genre—are set in the world of Disney's 2016 hit film Zootopia.

THU / November 10

The Big Brunch Reality competition HBO Max

Dan Levy hosts a new cooking competition that focuses on the meal that's not quite breakfast and not quite lunch but comes with a slice of canteloupe at the end. The first three episodes stream today.

▣ The Calling Drama Peacock

David E. Kelley's newest crime series (titled The Missing until just a few months ago) is an adaptation of the novel The Missing File by Dror A. Mishani. The eight-episode series centers on an NYPD detective named Avraham Avraham (played by Unorthodox's Jeff Wilbusch) who believes his spirituality gives him an edge in cracking cases. His beliefs, however, are put to the test when what begins as a routine investigation turns out to be anything but. Juliana Canfield (Succession), Karen Robinson, and Michael Mosley also star, while Barry Levinson directs today's opener and additional episodes.

Netflix's holiday rom-com stars Lindsay Lohan and Chord Overstreet as an amnesiac heiress and a ski lodge owner, respectively.

FRI / November 11

All Saints Street Anime Crunchyroll

Dylan & Zoey Drama ($) Rent/Buy

▣ The English Trailer Drama/Western Prime Video

A co-production between Amazon and the BBC, this violent and unsettling six-episode western from Hugo Blick (The Honourable Woman) is set on the American frontier in the 1890s—and, in particular, in a Wyoming town plagued by a series of unsolved murders—and stars Emily Blunt, Chaske Spencer, Rafe Spall, Toby Jones, Ciaran Hinds, Stephen Rea, and Tom Hughes. The entire series streams today.

A Gingerbread Christmas Drama discovery+

In Merry Measure Drama Hallmark, 8p

Veteran film critic Elvis Mitchell directs an examination of the history of Black cinema—with a special focus on films of the 1970s.

Directed by Nora Twomey (The Secret of Kells), this tale of friendship between a boy and a dragon is adapted from Ruth Stiles Gannett's award-winning children's book and features the voices of Jacob Tremblay, Rita Moreno, Gaten Matarazzo, Judy Greer, Chris O'Dowd, Dianne Wiest, Alan Cumming, and more.

▣ Mythic Quest Trailer Comedy Apple TV+

Co-star F. Murry Abraham is out, but the rest of the cast is back for season 3 of Apple's videogame developer workplace comedy, which picks up following last year's conclusion that saw key members of the company resigning to start a rival developer. The first two episodes stream today.

One Delicious Christmas Drama discovery+

Play-Doh Squished Trailer Reality competition Freevee

Transformers: EarthSpark Animation/Family Paramount+

SUN / November 13

Christmas at the Golden Dragon Drama Hallmark, 8p

My Best Friend's Christmas Drama GAF, 8p

Tulsa King Trailer Drama Paramount+

The latest Paramount+ series from Yellowstone creator Taylor Sheridan—we assume they'll eventually name the streaming service after him—features the first scripted TV starring role for Sylvester Stallone (Stop! Or My Mom Will Shoot). He plays a New York Mafia captain who is released from a multi-decade prison stay and is sent by his boss to run a new operation in Tulsa, Oklahoma. Domenick Lombardozzi (The Wire), Andrea Savage (I'm Sorry), Max Casella (Doogie Howser), Martin Starr (Silicon Valley), Dana Delany (Desperate Housewives), and Garrett Hedlund (Tron: Legacy) also star, while Boardwalk Empire creator Terence Winter serves as showrunner. Two episodes stream tonight on Paramount+ (followed by weekly single-episode installments), while the first episode will also air tonight on cable's Paramount Network following the Yellowstone premiere.

▣ Yellowstone Trailer Drama Paramount, 8p

The supersized fifth season will be divided in two seven-episode parts.

MON / November 14

Celebrity IOU Reality HGTV, 9p

Teletubbies [2022 reboot] Family

Call My Agent! [Korean version] Foreign/Comedy

In Her Hands Documentary

Leverage: Redemption Trailer Drama Freevee

Limitless With Chris Hemsworth Trailer Reality Disney+

Martha Cooks Reality The Roku Channel

The Santa Clauses Trailer Comedy/Family Disney+

Tim Allen returns for a miniseries sequel to his 1994 holiday movie The Santa Clause (and its two feature film sequels). Also back are Elizabeth Mitchell and David Krumholtz (who wisely skipped the third film), joined by newcomers like Kal Penn and (in a cameo) Peyton Manning. Jason Winer (Modern Family) directs, while Jack Burditt (30 Rock) produces.

The latest from Sebastián Lelio (Gloria, A Fantastic Woman, Disobedience) is an adaptation of Room author Emma Donoghue’s 1862-set novel about an English nurse (Florence Pugh) who travels to the Irish Midlands to observe an 11-year-old girl who has survived months without food, making her a saint to many in her tiny village. Critics had good things to say about the psychological thriller (which also opens in theaters on November 2nd) when it debuted at Telluride in September.

THU / November 17

▣ A Christmas Story Christmas Comedy/Drama/Family HBO Max

This sequel to the beloved 1983 holiday comedy A Christmas Story finds Ralphie (played once again by Peter Billingsley, who has spent most of the past few decades on the other side of the camera as a director and producer) returning to his childhood home with his own kids in tow. Also returning from the original film are Zack Ward, Scott Schwartz, Ian Petrella, and R.D. Robb, while new faces include Julie Hagerty (taking over as Ralphie's mom) and Erinn Hayes (as Ralphie's wife). It's technically the third sequel to the original film, though you'd be forgiven if you can't remember 1994's dud It Runs in the Family (aka My Summer Story) or the straight-to-video 2012 sequel A Christmas Story 2.

Christmas With You Rom-com

Netflix's first new holiday rom-com of at least the past 48 hours stars Freddie Prinze Jr. and Aimee Garcia.

Fleishman Is in Trouble Trailer Rom-com

Another FX-But-Really-Only-on-Hulu™ original series, Fleishman Is in Trouble is an eight-episode adaptation of the book of the same name by Taffy Brodesser-Akner (who also scripted the adaptation). Directed by Jonathan Dayton and Valerie Faris (Little Miss Sunshine), the series stars Jesse Eisenberg as a recently divorced New York doctor who just begins to re-enter the dating pool when his ex-wife (Claire Danes) disappears, leaving him to care for their two young children. Lizzy Caplan and Adam Brody also star, while Josh Radnor and Christian Slater also have recurring roles. Two episodes stream today.

▣ I Am Vanessa Guillén Documentary

Leopard Skin Drama Peacock

Elite Trailer Foreign/Drama

The Last Manhunt Trailer Western ($) Rent/Buy

Martha Holidays Reality The Roku Channel

Jeff Malmberg (Marwencol) directs a look at the history of Walt Disney's most famous character, Mickey Mouse. A new animated short, “Mickey in a Minute,” accompanies the documentary.

▣ The People We Hate at the Wedding Comedy Prime Video

Planet Sex With Cara Delevingne Reality

Poppy Drama IndiePix

▣ Spirited Comedy/Family/Musical Apple TV+

Ryan Reynolds and Will Ferrell head the cast for a musical adaptation of Charles Dickens' holiday classic A Christmas Carol. Octavia Spencer and Sunita Mani also star for director Sean Anders (Daddy's Home). The film, which features new original songs by Benj Pasek and Justin Paul (La La Land), will also play in theaters beginning November 11.

Jason Schwartzman, Lili Taylor, and Lennie James star in the latest indie dramedy from Andrew Bujalski (Support the Girls), which is also in theaters today.

Ziwe Talk/Comedy 11p

Elton John Live: Farewell From Dodger Stadium Live event Disney+

The L Word: Generation Q Drama 8p

Guests in season 3 include Margaret Cho, Kehlani, and Joey Lauren Adams. Each weekly episode will also be available to stream two days early (on Fridays).

My Favorite Christmas Tree Drama GAF, 8p

A Waltons Thanksgiving Drama 8p

Now do you believe that the average age of a CW viewer is 58? Is this not enough for you?

When I Think of Christmas Drama Hallmark, 8p

TUE / November 22

Nocebo Trailer Thriller ($) Rent/Buy

Welcome to Chippendales Trailer Drama

Kumail Nanjiani stars as Steve Banerjee, the Indian immigrant who founded the Chippendales male-stripping empire, in this eight-episode based-on-a-true-story limited series formerly titled Immigrant. Created by screenwriter Robert Siegel (who also created the recent Hulu miniseries Pam & Tommy), Chippendales is not exactly your standard American Dream success story—among other things, it's described as a true crime saga and a dark comedy—but the show does feature a strong cast that also includes Murray Bartlett, Dan Stevens, Annaleigh Ashford, Robin De Jesús, Andrew Rannells, and Juliette Lewis. Jenni Konner (Girls) serves as showrunner alongside Siegel, while Matt Shakman (WandaVision) directs. Two episodes stream today.

WED / November 23

Echo 3 Drama Apple TV+

A 10-episode bilingual action-thriller created by Oscar-winning screenwriter Mark Boal (The Hurt Locker) and adapted from an award-winning Israeli series called When Heroes Fly, Echo 3 centers on the disappearance of an American scientist (Jessica Ann Collins) near the border between Colombia and Venezuela. Attempting to track her down are her brother (Luke Evans) and husband (Michiel Huisman), each of whom have military experience but also complicated pasts. Three episodes stream today, followed by weekly single-episode installments on Fridays beginning December 2nd.

▣ Good Night Oppy Documentary Prime Video

Director Ryan White (Ask Dr. Ruth) traces what was expected to be a 90-day—but turned out to be a 15-year—mission of the Mars Exploration Rover named Opportunity. The film will also receive a limited theatrical run beginning November 4.

Pitch Perfect: Bumper in Berlin Trailer Comedy Peacock

Created by non-Emmy-winner Megan Amram (The Good Place), this spinoff from the Pitch Perfect film franchise centers on Adam DeVine's Bumper Allen, who moves to Germany in an attempt to revive his career after one of his songs becomes an unexpected hit in that country. Also returning from the films is fan favorite Flula Borg (as Pieter Krämer, now Bumper's manager), while newcomers include Jameela Jamil, Sarah Hyland, and Lera Abova.

Wednesday Clip Comedy/Horror

Netflix's new Addams Family spinoff series centering on the high school years of the now-teenaged Wednesday Addams (Jenna Ortega) comes from Smallville creators Alfred Gough and Miles Millar and finds Tim Burton directing half of the eight episodes—marking the latter's first TV work since a 1986 episode of Faerie Tale Theatre. Much of the action takes place at Wednesday's school, Nevermore Academy, where she will confront the supernatural mystery plaguing her family and attempt to stop a killing spree in the local town (in between homework assignments, presumably). Gwendoline Christie, Riki Lindhome, Jamie McShane, and Percy Hynes White also star, while Catherine Zeta-Jones and Luis Guzmán will recur as Morticia and Gomez Addams, respectively. Also appearing is Christina Ricci, who played Wednesday in a pair of 1990s Addams Family films but will be portraying a new character in the series.

THU / November 24

A Christmas Mystery Drama HBO Max

Criminal Minds: Evolution Drama Paramount+

Not really a new series, Evolution is a continuation of the CBS drama Criminal Minds, which ended its 15-season run in 2020. Returning cast members include Joe Mantegna, Paget Brewster, A.J. Cook, Aisha Tyler, Adam Rodriguez, and Kirsten Vangsness, while new faces include Zach Gilford. The first two (of 10) episodes stream today; additional episodes will arrive one per week on Thursdays (with a monthlong holiday break in the middle of the season).

The long-awaited sequel to the 2007 Disney princess movie Enchanted comes from director Adam Shankman (Hairspray) and finds returning cast members Amy Adams, Patrick Dempsey, Idina Menzel, and James Marsden joined by newcomers Maya Rudolph, Oscar Nunez, and Yvette Nicole Brown.

First Love Trailer Foreign/Drama

Holiday Harmony Drama HBO Max

My Southern Family Christmas Drama Hallmark, 8p

The Noel Diary Drama/Rom-com

Christmas at the Drive-In Drama GAF, 8p

Fantasy Football Comedy/Family/Sports Paramount+

A Royal Corgi Christmas Drama Hallmark, 8p

We're Here Reality 10p

#Xmas Drama Hallmark, 6p

SAT / November 26

Haul Out the Hollly Drama Hallmark, 8p

I'm Glad It's Christmas Drama GAF, 8p

A Tale of Two Christmases Drama Hallmark, 6p

Time for Him to Come Home for Christmas Drama HMM, 10p

SUN / November 27

Candace Cameron Bure Presents: A Christmas ... Present Drama GAF, 8p

A Christmas Cookie Catastrophe Drama Hallmark, 6p

A Holiday Spectacular Drama Hallmark, 8p

Rivalling only David Lynch's Twin Peaks (a clear influence) for its blend of supernatural horror, dark comedy, and out-and-out strangeness, Lars von Trier's Danish hospital TV series The Kingdom ran for two seasons in 1994 and 1997. (It was later remade in America by Stephen King, but not successfully.) But if Lynch could bring Peaks back for another round, why can't von Trier do the same with The Kingdom? And so we have Exodus, a third (and said to be final) set of five episodes, all directed by von Trier and featuring a mix of old and new faces (including, respectively, Udo Kier and Alexander Skarsgard), with the latter group mostly replacements for actors who have died since the prior miniseries. This time, the director gets, well, "meta" as he opens the series with a woman angered by watching that previous Kingdom season and winds up entering the hellish hospital herself. Episodes tream weekly, and if you have yet to see the original two seasons, those hard-to-find episodes will also begin streaming on MUBI on November 13 (for season 1) and November 20 (for the second season).

▣ Krapopolis Clip Animation/Comedy tbd

Special sneak preview of the new Dan Harmon animated series (set in the world of Greek mythology) that will make its proper series debut in early 2023.

TUE / November 29

Reindeer in Here Animation/Family 9p

WED / November 30

Irreverent Drama Peacock

This 10-episode Australian drama (actually a co-production with Netflix, though it's a Peacock exclusive in America) centers on a Chicago criminal played by Colin Donnell (Chicago Med). After botching a heist at home, he goes on the run and winds up in a small town in northern Australia, where he poses as the local church's reverend.

My Name Is Vendetta Trailer Foreign/Drama/Thriller

Snack vs. Chef Reality competition

Willow Trailer Drama/Fantasy Disney+
